source.model.sm_drive¶

This module contains continuous-time models for synchronous motor drives.

The motor model can be parametrized to represent a permanent-magnet synchronous motor and synchronous reluctance motor. Peak-valued complex space vectors are used.

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

SynchronousMotorDrive

Model of a synchronous motor drive.

SynchronousMotor

Synchronous motor.

Datalogger

Datalogger for a synchronous motor drive.
class source.model.sm_drive.SynchronousMotorDrive(pars)[source]¶

Model of a synchronous motor drive.

This interconnects the subsystems of a synchronous motor drive and provides the interface to the solver. More complicated systems could be simulated using a similar template.

Parameters

pars (ModelData object) – Contains the system model data.

get_initial_values(self)[source]¶

Get the initial values.

Returns

x0 – Initial values of the state variables.

Return type

complex list, length 2

Set the initial values.

Parameters

x0 (complex ndarray) – Initial values of the state variables.

Compute the complete state derivative list for the solver.

Parameters

  • t (float) – Time.

  • x (complex ndarray) – State vector.

Returns

State derivatives.

Return type

complex list

class source.model.sm_drive.SynchronousMotor(mech, pars)[source]¶

Synchronous motor.

This models a synchronous motor. The model is implemented in rotor coordinates.

R_s¶

Stator resistance.

Type

float

L_d¶

d-axis inductance.

Type

float

L_q¶

q-axis inductance.

Type

float

psi_f¶

PM-flux linkage.

Type

float

p¶

Number of pole pairs.

Type

int

psi_s0¶

Initial value of the stator flux linkage.

Type

complex

Parameters

  • mech (Mechanics object) – Mechanical subsystem model.

  • pars (ModelData object) – Contains the motor data.

current(self, psi_s)[source]¶

Compute the stator current.

Parameters

psi_s (complex) – Stator flux linkage.

Returns

i_s – Stator current.

Return type

complex

torque(self, psi_s, i_s)[source]¶

Compute the electromagnetic torque.

Parameters

  • psi_s (complex) – Stator flux linkage.

  • i_s (complex) – Stator current.

Returns

tau_M – Electromagnetic torque.

Return type

float

f(self, psi_s, i_s, u_s, w_M)[source]¶

Compute the state derivative.

Parameters

  • psi_s (complex) – Stator flux linkage.

  • u_s (complex) – Stator voltage.

  • w_M (float) – Rotor angular speed (in mechanical rad/s).

Returns

dpsi_s – Time derivative of the stator flux linkage.

Return type

complex
